item.title: 印尼在苹果谈判中获胜 10 亿美元开创先例
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社遍布全球的记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，法里斯-莫赫塔尔（Faris Mokhtar）回顾了苹果公司与印度尼西亚之间的谈判，以及这些谈判为其他渴望从欢迎跨国公司中获得更多利益的新兴经济体树立的明显模板。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Faris Mokhtar reviews the negotiations between Apple and Indonesia and the apparent template they set for other emerging economies keen to benefit more from welcoming multinationals.】

item.title: 鸡蛋危机迫使特朗普寻求更大规模的进口
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普本周总结了鸡蛋危机的严重程度，称其为 "灾难"。【原文：US President Donald Trump this week summed up the extent of the egg crisis when he called it a “disaster.”】

item.title: 德国推动国防开支面临选举现实
item.description: 我是 Zoe Scheeweiss，法兰克福的经济编辑。今天我们将探讨德国新政府在国防开支方面面临的财政限制。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Zoe Scheeweiss, an economics editor in Frankfurt. Today we’re looking at the fiscal constraints a new German government faces on defense spending. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net or get in touch on X via @economics. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 华尔街的风险承担者正在撤退
item.description: 市场数据截至美国东部时间上午 06:36。根据供应商协议，市场数据可能会有所延迟。【原文：Market data as of 06:36 am EST. Market data may be delayed depending on provider agreements.】

item.title: 美国银行分析师称劳斯莱斯股价应再涨 50
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America）给劳斯莱斯控股公司（Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc）的目标股价表明，即使这家英国喷气发动机制造商的估值在过去一年翻了一番，该股仍有可能再涨 50%。【原文：Bank of America gave Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc a price target that suggests the stock could rally another 50%, even after the British jet-engine maker’s valuation doubled in the past year.】

item.title: 伦敦石油派对周被唐纳德-特朗普的言论所笼罩
item.description: 本周，全球石油交易商来到伦敦，在梅菲尔区的酒吧和酒店里，他们重新习惯于查看手机，以了解唐纳德-特朗普接下来可能会说些什么。【原文：The world’s oil traders descended on London this week, and in the bars and hotels of the city’s Mayfair district they were getting re-accustomed to checking their phones for what Donald Trump might say next.】

item.title: 政策持续支持，中国新房销售保持稳定
item.description: 中国 2 月份的住宅销售略有增长，这表明在政策的持续支持下，房地产市场正在趋于稳定。【原文：China’s residential sales grew slightly in February, in a sign that the real estate market is stabilizing with continued policy support.】

item.title: 富人向美国经济发射现金大炮—但代价是什么？
item.description:
产业重新调整，经济信号交叉，社会结构开始动荡。【原文：

Industries get recalibrated, economic signals get crossed and the social fabric begins to fray.

】

item.title: 七月以来国债市场最大反弹面临关键美国数据
item.description: 美国政府债券投资者在一系列经济数据公布之前，结束了自 7 月份以来的最大月度涨幅，这些数据将决定他们是否能继续保持涨幅。【原文：Investors in US government bonds are wrapping up their biggest monthly gain since July ahead of a raft of economic data that will determine whether they get to keep it.】

item.title: 中国 Zara 试图走向世界，希望取得类似申银万国的成功
item.description: 快时尚零售商 Shein 在美国和欧洲市场为中国公司开辟了一条道路。现在，另一个中国服装品牌也想复制它的成功。【原文：Fast-fashion retailer Shein blazed a trail for Chinese companies in the US and European markets. Now, another China-based apparel brand wants to replicate its success.】

item.title: 特朗普回调对美联储的抨击，寻求另一种降息方式
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统抨击整个华盛顿政府机构的同时，他在第一任期最喜欢攻击的目标之一--美联储--却得到了相对轻松的待遇。【原文：As President Donald Trump lashes out at government agencies across Washington, one of his favorite first-term targets – the Federal Reserve – has been getting a relatively easy ride.】

item.title: 朝鲜 15 亿美元劫案让加密世界警醒
item.description: 上周五，加密货币交易所 Bybit 遭到大规模黑客攻击的消息不胫而走，网络安全研究人员迅速得出结论：巨额数字资产劫案的时代已经进入了一个新的阶段，而且有可能造成巨大损失。【原文：As news started spreading about a massive hack on crypto exchange Bybit last Friday, cybersecurity researchers quickly concluded that the era of giant digital-asset heists had entered a new and potentially ruinous phase.】

item.title: NatWest 的最大股东不再是英国政府
item.description: 在拯救 NatWest Group Plc 超过 16 年后，英国不再是该银行的最大股东。【原文：The UK is no longer the biggest shareholder in NatWest Group Plc more than sixteen years after rescuing the bank.】

item.title: 能跳舞、能战斗的 Unitree 机器人赢得北京创始人的赞誉
item.description: 上周，当中国国家主席习近平召集二十多位国家商界领袖举行峰会时，其中一位出人意料的与会者是一位鲜为人知的 34 岁机器人先驱。【原文：When Chinese President Xi Jinping gathered two dozen of the nation’s business leaders for a summit last week, one of the surprise attendees was a little-known, 34-year-old robot pioneer.】

item.title: 印度从俄罗斯的石油进口降至两年来最低水平
item.description: 数据分析公司Kpler的数据显示，印度本月从俄罗斯进口的原油量下滑至2023年1月以来的最低水平，这凸显了美国的严厉制裁是如何扰乱供应链的。【原文：India’s imports of crude oil from Russia slumped this month to the lowest level since January 2023, according to data analytics company Kpler, underlining how stringent US sanctions have disrupted supply chains.】

item.title: 特斯拉股价暴跌，投资者恐将遭受更多损失
item.description: 随着特斯拉股价的跌跌不休，一些投资者开始担心未来会有更大的下跌空间。【原文：As a rout in Tesla’s stock goes from bad to worse, some investors are bracing for more downside ahead.】

item.title: 印尼提供廉价航班和购物中心促销活动以刺激开斋节需求
item.description: 印尼经济总量达 14 万亿美元，在斋月节日期间通常会出现消费高峰，印尼零售商正在推出各种购物折扣计划，以刺激需求。【原文：Indonesian retailers are rolling out various shopping discount programs in the latest attempt to spur demand during the Ramadan festive season when consumption typically peaks in the $1.4-trillion economy.】

item.title: 中国应对特朗普加强贸易战的所有方式
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在过去七天里宣布了一系列令人眼花缭乱的针对中国的行动，而且在接下来的一个月里还会有更多行动。【原文：After a slower than expected start, the trade war between the US and China has begun to heat up, with President Donald Trump announcing a dizzying series of actions against China in the past seven days — and more to come over the next month.】

item.title: 德国工业界开始呼吁恢复使用俄罗斯天然气
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普努力结束乌克兰战争的鼓舞下，德国东部的一些企业已经开始计划俄罗斯天然气重返欧洲的时间。【原文：Some German industries in the east of the country are already planning for the time when Russian gas returns to Europe encouraged by the efforts of US President Donald Trump to end the war in Ukraine.】

item.title: 美银美林称 "特朗普看跌 "阴影笼罩，标普500指数逆转大选涨势
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp.）的策略师表示，如果美国 500 指数在大选后的涨势出现逆转，将引发投资者对唐纳德-特朗普总统进行干预以支持市场的预期。【原文：A reversal of the S&P 500’s post-election rally would spark investor expectations for intervention by President Donald Trump to support the market, according to Bank of America Corp. strategists.】

item.title: 中国突然撤换推动人工智能和芯片发展的科技沙皇
item.description: 中国突然撤换了负责监督北京打造世界级尖端芯片产业并与美国比肩成为高科技超级大国的国家科技沙皇。【原文：China has abruptly replaced the nation’s tech czar who oversees Beijing’s efforts to build a world-class, cutting-edge chip industry and rival the US as a high-tech superpower.】

item.title: 泰国中央银行董事会主席遴选备受争议
item.description: 泰国将任命一名前官僚为泰国银行新任主席，从而结束了一个充满争议的遴选过程，在这一过程中，政府曾试图推动一位有争议的前部长参选，但最终以失败告终。【原文：Thailand is set to appoint a former bureaucrat as the new chairman of the Bank of Thailand, capping a contentious selection process that saw the government fail in a bid to push through the candidacy of a controversial former minister.】

item.title: Global Insurers, Asset Managers Prepare Final Bids for Viridium
item.description: Some of the world’s largest insurers and asset managers are preparing final bids for German life insurance consolidator Viridium Group in one of the country’s most competitive deals this year, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: India’s Central Bank Adds $10 Billion Via Currency Swap to Ease Cash Crunch
item.description: India’s central bank injected $10 billion through a foreign-exchange swap auction on Friday, stepping up efforts to quell one of the worst liquidity deficits in the financial system.

item.title: 救援失败，安赛乐米塔尔南非公司将停产工厂
item.description: 安赛乐米塔尔南非有限公司（ArcelorMittal South Africa Ltd.）在与政府的救援谈判失败、经营环境恶化后，将关闭该国的重要钢厂。【原文：ArcelorMittal South Africa Ltd. will shutter crucial steel mills in the country after rescue talks with the government failed and the operating environment deteriorated.】

item.title: Rwanda Courts Arsenal, Bayern, PSG to Stay Put Despite Congo Conflict
item.description: Rwanda is courting European football clubs to maintain sponsorship deals as the Democratic Republic of Congo steps up pressure on the associations to sever ties, accusing its neighbor of destabilizing its mineral-rich eastern region.

item.title: Chinese EV Makers’ European Sales Stuck in Post-Tariff Plateau
item.description: China’s share of European electric-car sales was little changed again in January, with brands struggling to make inroads since the European Union imposed additional tariffs.

item.title: 关于美国劳动力市场面临的日益增长的风险的更多信息
item.description: Are we near stall speed?

item.title: Lots More on the Growing Risks to the US Labor Market (Podcast)
item.description: A week from today we will get the February jobs report and there are growing concerns that the US labor market is slowing. Already, the number of sectors adding jobs in this economy is on the decline. Meanwhile, the housing market continues to struggle. Add in the Department of Government Efficiency and worsening fiscal conditions in the state and local sector, and the government may prove to be a drag on employment. To talk about this and other macro developments, including possible tariffs, we

item.title: UK Property Portal Rightmove Sees Revenue Accelerating This Year
item.description: UK property portal Rightmove Plc expects revenue growth to accelerate this year as more prospective buyers take the plunge.
